author: The Star Online
title: From rising seas to rising scars | The Star
text:
CLIMATE change is forcing ever more Bangladeshis to emigrate to the Gulf in search of a better life but the dream often turns into a reality of abuse and exploitation endured in slave-like conditions, according to a new study.
“Vulnerable people pushed to the brink due to climate shocks take a huge gamble to pay for migration, but often end up in a situation where they face abuse,” said Ritu Bharadwaj, one of the report’s authors.
The survey of Bangladeshi migrants who moved from climate-vulnerable areas to work in the Gulf showed that nearly all had faced at least one form of exploitation in their new life, be it employer abuse, sexual attack or wage denial, the study found.
Migrants – most of whom move to states such as Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Oman – get locked into a form of “modern slavery” after taking out loans or selling land to pay the US$4,021 (RM17,854) it typically costs to secure work overseas, said the International Institute for Environment and Development (IIED).
The London-based think tank spoke to 648 households to learn how climate change had impacted those living on the frontline.
On the move
Migration has accelerated in the past two decades as the planet grows ever warmer, robbing people of a safe life, stable future or reliable income.
The study found that families in disaster-prone regions were now 1.6 times more likely to move within Bangladesh, and twice as likely to move abroad compared to households living in safer places.
Up to 88% of households sent someone abroad this past decade, compared to just 9% from 2001-2010 and 4% in the 1990s.
Bangladesh is the world’s seventh most vulnerable country to the impacts of climate change, and frequent disasters – from floods to cyclones – are taking a rising toll.
The economic costs of climate-related disasters have jumped four-fold – from about US$146mil annually during 1960-1990 to US$558mil in the last 30 years.
That cost each family in the disaster-prone coastal area more than US$870 (RM3,862) a year, the study said, leaving families with less for the staples of life such as food, education or health.
Among those affected were farmers, fishing communities and small business owners whose livelihoods were often the hardest hit, forcing them to seek out better prospects elsewhere.
Take the district of Pirojpur on the southern coast of Bangladesh, which has faced a slew of destructive floods and cyclones in recent years.
Teacher Abu Musa said he sent his younger brother to Dhaka to work as a security guard after last year’s monsoon destroyed crops and fisheries owned by his family.
“Repeated disaster losses make it harder to get through in recent years – and you can at least earn a steady income when you land a job in a place like Dhaka,” he said.
But many left only to face new risks and problems in their adopted cities – especially those who moved abroad.
The study said that migrants in the construction and garment industries in big cities were denied compensation when they had workplace accidents, while domestic workers faced beatings or inadequate food and bedding.
Migrants who move overseas face higher risks as they have no choice but to recoup their high startup costs, said Bharadwaj.
Employers often seize workers’ passports and bar them from leaving the workplace, denying them a chance to contact their families or the embassy, the study said.
Women suffer most: more than 80% of domestic workers faced abuses such as beating or sexual harassment in their host households, the survey found.
Where to turn?
As the number of Bangladeshi migrants in Gulf countries runs to the millions, embassies often struggle to monitor conditions or mount rescues, said the International Labour Organisation.
“The sad part is when a worker faces abuse, they often do not know where to turn to,” said Mohammad Rashed Alam Bhuiyan, an assistant professor of political science at the Dhaka University who studies Bangladeshi climate migrants.
The government could outsource essential services – such as health care or shelter for those at risk – to private organisations, he said.
Helping communities minimise climate-related losses at home could also cut the risk of overseas abuse, said Md Shamsuddoha, chief executive of Dhaka-based research organisation Centre for Participatory Research and Development (CPRD).
If families could get early alerts of disasters as well as cash support, they would be better informed and may be more likely to stay, he said.
Experts also pointed to the complex web of brokers helping migrants get work, from the Middle East to Malaysia.
These middlemen are often accused of fraud or deceit, underlining the need to better track the migrants, said Bharadwaj from IIED.
“We should not paint the agents and brokers supporting climate migration as villains – rather the government should register all the middlemen and work with them to ensure minimum standards for workers,” she said. — Reuters

title: El G20 reconoce la urgencia climática y se compromete con una nueva convención de la ONU - Infobae
text:
Río de Janeiro, 3 oct (EFE).- Los ministros de Medio Ambiente de los países del G20, en una amplia y ambiciosa declaración que alcanzó consenso tras un largo período de divergencias, reconocieron este jueves la urgencia del combate a los cambios climáticos y se comprometieron con una convención de la ONU para combatir la contaminación con plástico.
Además de anunciar su pleno respaldo a la total implementación de las tres convenciones ya existentes (biodiversidad, cambios climáticos y desertificación), las veinte mayores economías del mundo anunciaron su compromiso para sacar adelante una nueva, destinada a combatir la contaminación por plásticos, incluso en los océanos.
Los compromisos fueron asumidos en una declaración divulgada tras las reuniones que los ministros de Medio Ambiente y de Clima de los países del G20 tuvieron esta semana en Río de Janeiro y serán presentados a consideración en la Cumbre que el grupo tendrá el 18 y el 19 de noviembre también en esta ciudad brasileña.
El grupo destacó la necesidad de adoptar medidas urgentes para abordar las crisis y los desafíos que plantean el cambio climático, la pérdida de biodiversidad, la desertificación, la degradación de los océanos y de las tierras, la sequía y la contaminación.
"Estamos cada vez más comprometidos a abordar las crisis y los desafíos antes mencionados dado el hecho irrefutable de que los impactos del cambio climático ya se están sintiendo en todo el mundo, afectando de manera más severa a las regiones y países vulnerables, con inundaciones sin precedentes, sequías extremas, olas de calor superiores a la media y otros eventos para los que aún no estamos completamente preparados para enfrentar", afirmaron.
Según el G20, "las pérdidas humanas y ambientales en todo el mundo dejan en claro la necesidad urgente de tomar mayores medidas para responder a la nueva realidad global".
El G20 afirmó que su responsabilidad es mayor por responder no solo por el 80 % del producto interior bruto (PIB) mundial y el 80 % de la población mundial, sino también por cerca del 80 % de las emisiones contaminantes y por el 75% de la generación de desechos.
"Si las economías responsables por el 80 % de los recursos financieros del mundo hacemos nuestra tarea, con seguridad estaremos dando una gran contribución al desafío que está sobre la mesa, que es evitar que la temperatura de la tierra aumente otros 1,5 grados centígrados", afirmó la ministra brasileña de Medio Ambiente, Marina Silva, en una rueda de prensa.
Los ministros se dijeron decididos a elevar su participación en las próximas reuniones ambientales multilaterales, especialmente en las responsables por la implementación de las convenciones de la ONU, así como a participar activamente en la negociación para el desarrollo de un instrumento internacional jurídicamente vinculante sobre la contaminación por plásticos.
"Reconocemos la necesidad de intensificar nuestros esfuerzos colectivos para poner fin a la contaminación plástica y nos comprometemos a trabajar juntos con la ambición de concluir para fines de 2024 las negociaciones de un instrumento internacional jurídicamente vinculante ambicioso, justo y transparente sobre la contaminación plástica, incluso en el medio marino", dijeron.
Igualmente se comprometieron a impulsar la entrada en vigor lo antes posible del Acuerdo de la ONU sobre la conservación y el uso sostenible de la biodiversidad marina en áreas más allá de la jurisdicción nacional.
En el documento los países del G20 también asumieron compromisos en tres capítulos específicos: la preservación de los océanos, los mecanismos para pagar por los servicios ecosistémicos (financiar a los países que preservan) y la mejoría en la gestión de los recursos para impulsar una economía circular. title: 香瓜、蜂箱、青蔥也能申請 彰縣近9成農損納入現金救助
text:
香瓜、蜂箱、青蔥也能申請 彰縣近9成農損納入現金救助
蔥田被大雨襲擊後，根部腐爛。（記者張聰秋攝）
〔記者張聰秋／彰化報導〕香瓜、蜂箱和青蔥也能申請補助了！彰化縣因水患襲擊，農業災損持續擴大，農業部今天（11日）公告第二波災損現金救助與低利貸款適用品項，新增洋香瓜、香瓜、柑橘類、百香果、青割玉米、玫瑰、洋桔梗及養蜂等項目，補助標準每公頃最高18萬元，最低也有1.2萬元，蜂箱則也依箱數補貼，每箱最高660元，總算回應基層的聲音。
第二波擴大新增補助品項，彰化縣目前接近9成農損納入現金救助。農業處表示，大量農田泡水爛根、蜂箱浸水被污染、果樹裂果無法採收，災情遍及雜糧、果樹、牧草等。農業部核定彰化縣為現金救助與低利貸款地區，凡農損達2成以上的農友，今天起至7月24日止，可攜帶身分證、印章、農會存簿與土地權狀或使用同意書，向所在地公所申報。
農業處表示，第二波公告補助項目與額度，雜糧類的硬質玉米、高粱每公頃2萬8000元，牧草類的青割玉米每公頃1萬2000元，果樹類的西瓜每公頃6萬2000元。另外，香瓜、洋香瓜、柑橘類每公頃8萬元。
花卉類的唐菖蒲、草皮等每公頃9萬元；玫瑰、洋桔梗、滿天星、火鶴、百合等每公頃18萬元；養蜂的蜂箱每箱補助660元（全毀）、360元（半毀），蜂群每群補助460元。
根部被浸爛的青蔥，在第二波農損現金補助中納入。（記者張聰秋攝）
彰化蜂箱泡水多日變破箱，蜂蜜被積水污染，完全報廢。（縣府提供）
彰化縣政府今公布第二波新增農損現金救助品項，連同昨天的第一波，目前全縣近9成都納入補助。（縣府提供）
彰化縣政府提醒農民拍照存證在期限內提出農損現金災害救助。（縣府提供）

title: Lynn Azar Appointed Senior VP at Sony Interactive Entertainment: Finance, Strategy, and Corporate Development Leadership Unveiled
text:
Lynn Azar Takes the helm as SVP at Sony Interactive Entertainment SAN MATEO, Calif. – In a strategic move designed to reinforce its position in the competitive interactive entertainment sector, Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE) has announced the appointment of Lynn Azar as Senior Vice President (SVP), Finance , Corporate Advancement and Strategy.The appointment, effective April 1, 2025, signifies a key transition within the company’s leadership structure. azar succeeds Lin Tao, who will be promoted to Chief Financial Officer of Sony Group Corporation, also effective April 1, 2025. this change underscores Sony’s dedication to nurturing internal talent and ensuring strategic alignment across its global operations.
Lynn Azar’s promotion to SVP is a recognition of her proven track record and in-depth understanding of SIE’s financial operations. Her expertise is expected to be crucial in driving the company’s continued growth and innovation within the dynamic gaming market. This move signals a renewed emphasis on strategic financial planning and corporate development initiatives within the PlayStation ecosystem, aiming to further solidify its market leadership.
A seasoned Leader Joins the Executive Team Hideaki Nishino, CEO Platform Business Group, Sony Interactive Entertainment, expressed his enthusiasm for Azar’s appointment, stating: I am thrilled to welcome Lynn to the SIE leadership team. her extensive experience, leadership, and vision will be critical as we continue to innovate, expand our business, and deliver world-class experiences to gamers worldwide. Nishino’s statement emphasizes the meaning of Azar’s role in shaping the future of PlayStation and its commitment to providing cutting-edge entertainment experiences to its global audience.
Azar brings a wealth of knowledge to her new position. Since joining SIE in 2020, she has served as SVP, Head of Finance and Operations for PlayStation Studios. In this role, she has overseen critical functions such as operations, budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling for growth. Her responsibilities also included managing PlayStation Studio’s mergers and acquisitions, corporate development initiatives, financial reporting, and compliance. This broad experience makes her exceptionally well-suited to lead SIE’s financial and strategic initiatives.
Extensive Experience and a Vision for the Future Before her tenure at SIE, Azar spent 18 years at Shell, including serving as VP of Finance. This extensive background in corporate finance and leadership provides her with a unique perspective on managing complex financial operations and driving strategic growth within a global institution. Her experience at Shell honed her skills in navigating intricate financial landscapes and making data-driven decisions, skills that are highly transferable to the gaming industry.
Azar herself expressed her enthusiasm about her new role,stating: This is an incredibly exciting period of growth and innovation in the interactive entertainment industry. I look forward to working alongside this talented team to cultivate a culture of operational excellence and value creation, always keeping gamers at the core of our efforts. her commitment to operational excellence and value creation aligns with SIE’s mission to deliver remarkable gaming experiences to its global audience, ensuring that player satisfaction remains a top priority.
Sony Interactive Entertainment: A Legacy of Innovation Sony Interactive entertainment has been a driving force in the gaming industry since the launch of the original PlayStation in Japan in 1994. The company continues to push the boundaries of entertainment and innovation through its PlayStation line of products and services, which includes generation-defining hardware, pioneering network services, and award-winning games. Headquartered in San Mateo,California,with global functions in California,London,and Tokyo,and game development studios around the world as part of PlayStation studios,SIE believes that the power of play is borderless. Sony Interactive entertainment is a wholly owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.
The appointment of Lynn Azar as SVP marks a new chapter in SIE’s ongoing commitment to financial excellence and strategic growth. Her leadership and expertise are expected to play a crucial role in shaping the future of PlayStation and delivering innovative entertainment experiences to gamers worldwide. This strategic move positions SIE to capitalize on emerging trends and maintain its competitive edge in the ever-evolving gaming landscape.
Sony’s Strategic Power Play: Lynn Azar’s Rise and the Future of PlayStation Is Sony interactive Entertainment quietly setting the stage for a new era of dominance in the gaming industry with the appointment of Lynn Azar?
Interviewer: Dr. Anya Sharma, a leading expert in corporate strategy and the entertainment industry, welcome to World Today news. Lynn Azar’s promotion to SVP of Finance, Corporate Development, and Strategy at Sony Interactive Entertainment has generated important buzz. What are your initial thoughts on this pivotal appointment?
Dr.Sharma: The appointment of Lynn Azar is more than just a reshuffling of executive roles; it’s a strategic maneuver reflecting Sony’s commitment to internal growth and a smart play in the increasingly competitive gaming market. Azar’s extensive background in finance, coupled with her operational experience within PlayStation Studios, positions SIE for sustained success. This is not simply about filling a position; it’s about strategically aligning leadership for future expansion.
A Deep Dive into Azar’s Impact Interviewer: Azar’s responsibilities are broad, encompassing finance, corporate development, and strategy. How do these areas interconnect, and what kind of impact can we expect from such a multifaceted role?
Dr. Sharma: The intersection of finance, corporate development, and strategy is critical for any large corporation, and notably so in a dynamic sector like interactive entertainment. Strong financial planning is the foundation for strategic decision-making. Corporate development, involving mergers and acquisitions, allows for expansion and diversification. And strategy integrates all these components to chart a course for sustained, profitable growth. azar’s experience in all three areas makes her uniquely positioned to optimize SIE’s performance across all these interconnected dimensions. We should expect to see improvements in several areas: increased efficiency in financial operations , more aggressive and strategic growth initiatives including potential acquisitions of smaller studios and technologies, and a stronger focus on long-term strategic planning .
Azar’s Background: From Shell to PlayStation Interviewer: Azar’s experience at Shell also appears highly relevant. How dose her past experience translate to her new role at SIE?
Dr. sharma: Azar’s eighteen years at Shell provided her with invaluable experience in managing complex global financial operations within a vast,multinational association. She gained a deep understanding of large-scale financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and resource allocation – all crucial skills for guiding SIE’s financial strategy. The transition from a massive energy conglomerate to a leading gaming company might seem drastic,but the underlying principles of strategic financial management remain remarkably similar .Her experience navigating the intricacies of a global multinational will prove extremely valuable as SIE continues its expansion and diversification efforts.
Navigating the Competitive Gaming Landscape Interviewer: The gaming industry is fiercely competitive. What specific challenges and opportunities does Azar face, and how well positioned is SIE to navigate these?
Dr. Sharma: The interactive entertainment arena is crowded, with established players and aspiring newcomers vying for market share. Azar faces the challenge of maintaining SIE’s competitive edge in a landscape marked by rapid technological advancements and evolving consumer preferences. Opportunities exist in burgeoning areas like cloud gaming, esports, and the metaverse. SIE is well-positioned to leverage Azar’s expertise to capitalize on these evolving trends: the PlayStation ecosystem is already a strong foundation, with a loyal user base and a consistently strong portfolio of games. Her strategic insights will be critical in navigating the challenges and converting the many opportunities into tangible success for the company.
The Future of PlayStation: A Strategic Outlook Interviewer: What are your overall predictions regarding SIE’s trajectory under Azar’s leadership?
Dr. Sharma: I anticipate a period of strategic growth and sustained profitability for SIE. Azar’s emphasis on operational excellence,coupled with her understanding of strategic finance and corporate development,will likely lead to:
Increased efficiency and profitability across PlayStation Studios and operations.
Strategic acquisitions to broaden SIE’s portfolio and expand into new markets.
A sharper focus on long-term growth,leveraging evolving technologies and market trends.
By focusing on innovation, operational excellence, and judicious strategic acquisitions, SIE, under Azar’s leadership, is well-poised for success in the exciting and ever-evolving world of interactive entertainment.
